de.unlixx.runpng.png.chunks

Class PngText

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unlixx.runpng.png.chunks.PngText

  • public class PngText
extends java.lang.Object
    Container for a png text chunk (tEXt, zTXt, iTXt). These chunks are starting always with a keyword of length 1 - 79. All other textual members may contain text or may be null. In case of compression: Only the text itself shall be compressed. All other textual members must remain uncompressed.
    See Also:
    https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11tEXt, https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11zTXt, https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11iTXt, http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/1.2/PNG-Chunks.html

    • Constructor Detail

      • PngText

        public PngText(java.lang.String strKeyword,
               java.lang.String strText)
        Constructor for chunk type tEXt. Where keyword and text must have character set ISO 8859-1.
        Parameters:
        strKeyword - A string of length 1 - 79. This must not be null.
        strText - A string containing a text. In case of tEXt it is limited to 32688 (max. chunk length - 80).

      • PngText

        public PngText(java.lang.String strKeyword,
               int nCompressionMethod,
               java.lang.String strText)
        Constructor for chunk type zTXt. Where keyword and text must have character set ISO 8859-1.
        Parameters:
        strKeyword - A string of length 1 - 79. This must not be null.
        nCompressionMethod - An int containing the compression method. Actually only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression) is internationally standardized for png.
        strText - A string containing a text. A limitation is not specified, but the length of the compressed text should not exceed 32687 (max. chunk length - 81).

      • PngText

        public PngText(java.lang.String strKeyword,
               int nCompressionFlag,
               int nCompressionMethod,
               java.lang.String strLanguageTag,
               java.lang.String strTranslatedKeyword,
               java.lang.String strText)
        Constructor for chunk type iTXt. Where keyword and language tag must have character set ISO 8859-1, while the translated keyword and the text must be coded in character set UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        strKeyword - A string of length 1 - 79. This must not be null.
        nCompressionFlag - An int containing 0 (uncompressed) or 1 (compressed).
        nCompressionMethod - An int containing the compression method. Actually only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression) is internationally standardized for png.
        strLanguageTag - A string containing a language code according RFC 3066. Or null, if not specified.
        strTranslatedKeyword - The language specific translated keyword. Or null, if not specified.
        strText - A string containing a text. A limitation is not specified, but the overall length of the whole chunk (compressed or not) should not exceed 32768 bytes (max. chunk length).
        See Also:
        https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt

      • PngText

        PngText(int nChunkType,
        java.lang.String strKeyword,
        int nCompressionFlag,
        int nCompressionMethod,
        java.lang.String strLanguageTag,
        java.lang.String strTranslatedKeyword,
        java.lang.String strText)
        Constructor for chunk type tEXt, zTXt, iTXt.
        Parameters:
        nChunkType - An int containing one of PngConstants.tEXt, PngConstants.zTXt or PngConstants.iTXt.
        strKeyword - A string of length 1 - 79. This must not be null.
        nCompressionFlag - An int containing 0 (uncompressed) or 1 (compressed).
        nCompressionMethod - An int containing the compression method. Actually only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression) is internationally standardized for png.
        strLanguageTag - A string containing a language code according RFC 3066. Or null, if not specified.
        strTranslatedKeyword - The language specific translated keyword. Or null, if not specified.
        strText - A string containing a text. In case of tEXt it is limited to 32688 (max. chunk length - 80). In other cases the overall length of the whole chunk (compressed or not) should not exceed 32768 bytes (max. chunk length).
        See Also:
        https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt

      • getChunkType

        public int getChunkType()
        Gets the chunk type.
        Returns:
        An int containing one of PngConstants.tEXt, PngConstants.zTXt or PngConstants.iTXt.

      • getKeyword

        public java.lang.String getKeyword()
        Gets the keyword of this text chunk.
        Returns:
        A string of length 1 - 79. This must not be null.

      • getCompressionFlag

        public int getCompressionFlag()
        Gets the compression flag.
        Returns:
        An int containing 0 (uncompressed) or 1 (compressed).

      • getCompressionMethod

        public int getCompressionMethod()
        Gets the compression method.
        Returns:
        An int containing the compression method. Actually only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression) is internationally standardized for png.

      • getLanguageTag

        public java.lang.String getLanguageTag()
        Gets the language tag of this text chunk.
        Returns:
        A string containing a language code according RFC 3066. Or null, if not specified.
        See Also:
        https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt

      • getTranslatedKeyword

        public java.lang.String getTranslatedKeyword()
        Gets the translated keyword of this text chunk.
        Returns:
        The language specific translated keyword. Or null, if not specified.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the text content of this text chunk.
        Returns:
        A string containing the text. Or null, if not specified.
